Urbana, Illinois /
Dear Harry:
I have your note of July 2 concerning the Prix Italia Jury.
I presume in the light of your more recent letter that you
have already received the date of the meeting of that Jury
and have notified Miss Lawler.
In view of the fact that most of the participants on the music
jury last year were world famous conductors there is a strong
doubt in my mind whether anybody in the Music Educators
National Conference could measure up to the stature of the
people representing the foreign broadcasting systems on that
Jury. Nevertheless, I suppose in view of the fact that we have
no other choice that we had best go along with whatever Miss
Lawler comes up with.
With all best wishes, believe me.
